docs.title: 1. Install Nix using Determinate Systems installer
2. Install Xcode Command Line Tools (if on mac)
3. Clone this repo
docs.text:
• Use git in a temporary nix-shell
nix-shell -p git

Clone the repo.

mkdir ~/nix-config
cd ~/nix-config
git clone https://github.com/aleksanderbl29/nix-config .

Exit the nix-shell after cloning the repo.

docs.title: 4. Build the system for the first time
docs.text:
You don't have to specify the hostname as long as the machine hostname is one of the outputs in flake.nix.

MacOS

nix --extra-experimental-features "nix-command flakes" run nix-darwin -- switch --flake ~/nix-config/

NixOS

sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake ~/nix-config#

All subsequent rebuilds can be done with the same command on all systems.

nixswitch

docs.title: Manual settings
docs.text:
This is a list of the macOS settings that needs to be set manually

  • Turn off animations
  • Enable three-finger swipe down (app-expose)
  • Reduce motions
  • System settings -> Accessibility -> Display -> Reduce motion
  • Enable keyboard shortcut for space 1-5

This to do list is for my personal mac machine. A more elaborate to do list system will come at some point.

  1. Run the steps in the readme.
  2. Sign in to app store
    • Maybe run nixswitch once more.
  3. Setup basic preferences

    • Start alt-tab
    • Change keyboard shortcut to cmd+tab
  4. Sign in to (and setup for machine-start) bitwarden
  5. Cloud storage that needs signing in:
    • OneDrive
    • Dropbox
  6. Import settings (plist) into stats.
  7. Sign in to outlook app

Also do take a look at the other pages on the left hand side.
